raw_comment:
What do you notice?

More women reach out than men and both men and women prefer to send texts and phone or video-chat, than visit in person.

What do you wonder?

I wonder why more women than men reach out to their parent. I also wonder how the different ages in this graph and the different lives of the people surveyed affects the data. For example, done people have good relationships with their parents and some don’t. 

How does this relate to you and your community?

This relates to me and my community because it’s very important for everyone to, if they have a good relationship with them, to reach out to their parent at least semi-often because they usually need it.

Create a catchy headline that captures the graph’s main idea.

Parents Were Right: The Phone Does Work Both Ways
ace_sentences: More women reach out to a parent than men.
Men and women prefer to send texts than to visit a parent in person.
Men and women prefer to phone or video-chat than to visit a parent in person.
I wonder why more women than men reach out to a parent.
I wonder how the ages in the graph affect the data.
I wonder how the lives of the surveyed people affect the data.
Some surveyed people have a good relationship with a parent.
Some surveyed people do not have a good relationship with a parent.
This relates to me and my community.
It is important that a person reaches out to a parent semi-often.
This is important if the person has a good relationship with the parent.
A parent usually needs this contact.
The headline is: Parents Were Right: The Phone Does Work Both Ways.
